sentence.Network_en: His testimony, however, was only one in a salvo of new attacks.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而他的证词只是新一轮唇枪舌剑中的一股火力。

sentence.Network_en: Three miles away there was a salvo of blasting in the quarry.
sentence.Network_cn: 三英里之外的采石场进行了爆破作业。

sentence.Network_en: They were to fire a salvo of blanks, after the national anthem.
sentence.Network_cn: 奏完国歌后，他们将同时发射空弹。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (earlier as salve): from French salve, Italian salva 'salutation'

entry.tran: (枪炮、导弹的)齐射，并发;(礼炮的)齐鸣
entry.def: A salvo is the firing of several guns or missiles at the same time in a battle or ceremony.

example.ex: They were to fire a salvo of blanks, after the national anthem.
example.tran: 奏完国歌后，他们将同时发射空弹。

entry.tran: (书面或口头的)一连串，一顿，一阵(生气的话)
entry.def: A salvo of angry words is a lot of them spoken or written at about the same time.

example.ex: His testimony, however, was only one in a salvo of new attacks.
example.tran: 然而他的证词只是新一轮唇枪舌剑中的一股火力。

means.word_mean: 1. an outburst resembling the discharge of firearms or the release of bombs

sentences.sentence: "our fusillade from the left flank caught them by surprise"
